description.en: International law is traditionally concerned with inter-state relations, but nowadays it involves likewise international organisations and, to a lesser extent, also natural and legal persons. The course provides a broad understanding of the central principles and main branches of international law, e.g., jurisdiction, immunity, state responsibility, peaceful settlement of disputes, law of treaties, diplomatic law, law of the sea and use of armed force. In addition to the theoretical foundation, relevant practices of states, courts and international organisations are examined in connection with discussed topics.
description.et: Rahvusvaheline õigus keskendub tavaliselt riikidevahelistele suhetele, kuid hõlmab tänapäeval ka rahvusvahelisi organisatsioone ja vähemal määral ka füüsilisi ja juriidilisi isikuid. Kursus tutvustab rahvusvahelise õiguse keskseid printsiipe ja harusid (jurisdiktsioon ja immuniteet, vastutus, konfliktide rahumeelne lahendamine, rahvusvaheliste lepingute õigus, konsulaar- ja diplomaatiline õigus, merendusõigus, inimõigused, jne).

objectives.en: To provide an understanding of the central principles and main branches of international law and to develop the skills necessary to assess the conduct of international actors from international law perspective
objectives.et: Anda arusaam rahvusvahelise õiguse kesksetest põhimõtetest ja peamistest harudest ning arendada oskusi, mis on vajalikud, et hinnata rahvusvaheliste toimijate käitumist lähtuvalt rahvusvahelisest õigusest

learning_outcomes.en: The student who has passed the course is able to:
-- Explain the central principles of international law
-- Describe the sources of international law
-- Understand the relation between international and national legal systems
learning_outcomes.et: -- Mõistma rahvusvahelise ja riigisiseste õigussüsteemide suhet

learning_outcomes.en: -- Identify the subjects of international law
-- Find and apply the substantial regulation of the main branches of international law
learning_outcomes.et: -- Leidma ja rakendama rahvusvahelise õiguse peamiste harude sisulist regulatsiooni

learning_outcomes.en: -- Solve hypothetical legal cases concerning international law
learning_outcomes.et: -- Lahendab rahvusvahelist õigust puudutavaid hüpoteetilisi kaasusi

description.et:
Criteria
-- Consistency, completeness and correctness of the answers to theoretical questions
-- Creativeness and consistency of the solutions to hypothetical cases 
-- Depth of the analysis of problems and applicable norms and principles
-- Association of theory with state and court practice
-- Structure, grammar and formatting
Grades
-- A: Answers to theoretical questions are remarkable; the examination of hypothetical cases is full, logical and creative; the analysis of legal problems is detailed and innovative; all relevant norms and principles have been used; the references to state and court practice are thoughtful and creative; the form is excellent; overall, the text is a remarkable achievement [91-100 points]
-- B: Answers to theoretical questions are very good with insignificant mistakes or omissions; the examination of hypothetical cases is purposeful and creative; the analysis of legal problems is very good with insignificant deficiencies; necessary norms and principles have been used; the references to state and court practice support the conclusions; the form is very good; overall, the treatment of the subject is logical and smooth [81-90 points]
-- C: Answers to theoretical questions are good, but there are mistakes or omissions; the examination of hypothetical cases addresses correctly the central issues; the analysis of legal problems is good with some deficiencies concerning specific issues; key norms and principles have been used; the form is good; overall, the coverage of the subject is logical, but there are some weaknesses from the point of view of the whole [71-80 points]
-- D: Answers to theoretical questions are fair, but there are several mistakes or omissions; the examination of hypothetical cases is satisfactory, but focuses only on the central aspects; the analysis of legal problems is satisfactory with deficiencies is most aspects; only basic norms and principles have been used; the form is fair; overall, the treatment of the subject is plausible, but insecure [61-70 points]
-- E: Answers to theoretical questions are poor with significant mistakes or omissions; the examination of hypothetical cases is weak and limited only to the very basic aspects; the analysis of legal problems is shallow with significant deficiencies is most aspects; only some rudimentary norms and principles have been used; overall, the coverage of the subject suffers of superficial treatment, poor knowledge of law and unsound presentation [51-60 points]

grade_evaluation.et:
Written exam with three questions (total 100 points):
-- Definition (15 points)
-- Theoretical concept (50 points)
-- Hypothetical case (35 points)

debt_elimination.et: In accordance with the Study Regulations and in consultation with the course instructor

assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials:
Books
-- One international law textbook in English by student's choice [most contain chapters on all topics discussed in classes]
Treaties and Documents
-- Charter of the United Nations (1945)
-- Statute of the International Court of Justice (1945)
-- European Convention for the Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms (1950)
-- Vienna Convention on Diplomatic Relations (1961)
-- Vienna Convention on the Law of Treaties (1969)
-- Additional Protocol (I) relating to the Protection of Victims of International Armed Conflicts (1977)
-- United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea (1982)
-- Rome Statute of the International Criminal Court (1998)
-- Draft Articles on Responsibility of States for Internationally Wrongful Acts (2001)

-- Jan Klabbers, International Law (2nd edn, Cambridge University Press, 2017)
